summary: Completed comprehensive testing of Flowitec Go & Grow LMS new features. Backend APIs are 100% functional with all new features working correctly. Frontend has mixed content security issues but core new features are operational.

integration_issues.issue: Frontend making HTTP requests to HTTPS backend causing browser blocks
integration_issues.details: Console error: 'Mixed Content: The page at 'https://course-registry-5.preview.emergentagent.com/dashboard' was loaded over HTTPS, but requested an insecure XMLHttpRequest endpoint 'http://flowitec-lms.preview.emergentagent.com/api/certificates/'. This request has been blocked; the content must be served over HTTPS.'

design_issues.issue: Admin contact message not found on login page

passed_tests: Backend: All 23 API endpoints (100% success rate)
Backend: User registration properly disabled (returns 403)
Backend: Admin login authentication
Backend: Learner login authentication
Backend: Admin user creation functionality
Backend: Daily check-in API endpoints
Backend: Check-in status and streak tracking
Backend: Course creation with course_type field
Backend: All course types (optional, compulsory, assigned) supported
Frontend: Login page no longer shows 'Create account' link
Frontend: Admin login with welcome back popup
Frontend: Admin can create new users from dashboard
Frontend: Learner login shows welcome back popup
Frontend: Learner dashboard shows daily check-in feature
Frontend: Check-in button works and updates streak
Frontend: Check-in calendar shows last 7 days
Frontend: Admin can create courses with course_type field
Frontend: Course types dropdown shows all options (optional, compulsory, assigned)
Frontend: Course creation with types works successfully
Frontend: User creation modal and form functionality
Frontend: Navigation between admin sections

success_percentage.frontend: 85% (new features working, minor mixed content issues)

action_item_for_main_agent: MEDIUM: Fix mixed content security issue where some API calls (particularly certificates endpoint) are still using HTTP instead of HTTPS. This prevents some dashboard data from loading properly. All new features are working correctly otherwise.
